alert.note: Alert for Hardin; Mercer (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 2:11PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN SHELBY, AUGLAIZE, WEST CENTRAL HARDIN AND SOUTHEASTERN MERCER COUNTIES THROUGH 300 PM EDT... At 211 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Celina, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Wapakoneta, St. Marys, Fort Shawnee, New Bremen, Minster, Cridersville, Botkins, New Knoxville, Alger, Waynesfield, Moulton, Chickasaw, Buckland, Uniopolis, Kettlersville, Montezuma, Fryburg, Egypt, Maria Stein and Kossuth. This includes I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 103 and 118. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM EDT for west central Ohio. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for west central Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
